issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
Failures to create volumes (in this case due to EQ SAN has reached it's max volume limit) result in a volume progressing to 'available' and not 'failed'. Example of this error shown in the test and log output below. Volume 'vol-F5964095' fails at creation, but displays available status. Later attempts to use the new volume fail. 
Thanks,
-M


From test:
{code}
SUCCESS: instance got private IP: 10.25.71.11
	waiting to be able to ping instance (10.25.71.11) from cc (192.168.51.28): (0/30)
SUCCESS: instance private IP pingable from CC: instanceip=10.25.71.11 ccip=192.168.51.28
SUCCESS: created volume: vol=vol-F5964095
	STATE: available 2012-12-04T03:48:01.152Z
SUCCESS: volume became available: vol=vol-F5964095, volstate=available
FAILED: CMD=runat 180 ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@192.168.51.28 source /root/eucarc; export EC2_URL=http://192.168.51.28:8773/services/Eucalyptus; export EUCALYPTUS=/; export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.6.0-openjdk-1.6.0.0.x86_64/jre; export PATH=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.6.0-openjdk-1.6.0.0.x86_64/jre/bin:$PATH;  euca-attach-volume vol-F5964095 -i i-D92F411D -d /dev/vdb 
RUNATCMD: ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@192.168.51.28 source /root/eucarc; export EC2_URL=http://192.168.51.28:8773/services/Eucalyptus; export EUCALYPTUS=/; export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.6.0-openjdk-1.6.0.0.x86_64/jre; export PATH=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.6.0-openjdk-1.6.0.0.x86_64/jre/bin:$PATH;  euca-attach-volume vol-F5964095 -i i-D92F411D -d /dev/vdb  
Warning: Permanently added '192.168.51.28' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
AttachVolumeType: Failed to send message AttachStorageVolumeType to service StorageInternal because: example: [SANVolumeInfo volumeId=vol-F5964095 scName=PARTI00 iqn=null storeUser=null encryptedPassword=null size=null status=null snapshotOf=null id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
{code}

fields.summary: Failed volume creation may result in an 'available' volume

comments.body:
Comment from gholms:

This only happens on equallogic.
[~mmunn1], can you verify that this is the same as euca-2366
This is a completely different issue and is not related to EUCA-2366

The problem for this bug is that we are not handling the specific error correctly. When equallogic reaches its LUN number limit, it reports:

eucagrp0> volume create yetestsize 1024
% Error - Maximum number of volumes was reached
eucagrp0> 

SC somehow does not think it is an error and reports success. Need to check if there is anything special with this type of error, like maybe the return value from ssh command is 0.
